content.question: Cars <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> have the same mass. Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is moving with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> in the <math alttext="negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction, Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is at rest, and Car <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> is moving with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction. Which of the following correctly ranks the kinetic energy <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> of the three cars?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub C is greater than K sub A, which is greater than K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub C is greater than K sub B, which is greater than K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub B is greater than open parenthesis, K sub A equals K sub C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, K sub A equals K sub C, close parenthesis, is greater than K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, K sub A equals K sub C, close parenthesis, is greater than K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
